meanings.definition: The quality of being rough or harsh in manner or temperament.
meanings.sent1: Her abrasiveness made it difficult for others to approach her.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's abrasiveness towards the students was off-putting.
meanings.sent3: Despite his abrasiveness, he always had a soft spot for puppies.
meanings.sent4: The abrasiveness of his words left a lasting impact on her.
meanings.sent5: The abrasiveness of the sandpaper smoothed out the rough edges of the wood.

meanings.definition: The degree to which a substance can cause wear or damage by rubbing or grinding against another surface.
meanings.sent1: The abrasiveness of the cleaning solution was perfect for removing tough stains.
meanings.sent2: The abrasiveness of the sandpaper was ideal for smoothing down the rough surface.
meanings.sent3: She joked that the cat's tongue had the same abrasiveness as sandpaper.
meanings.sent4: The abrasiveness of time slowly eroded the ancient statue.
meanings.sent5: The abrasiveness of the rock against her skin left a stinging sensation.
